Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Holiday Inn during our trip to Rome. This was probably the nicest Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in! They offer a shuttle from the airport for free and since it is a bit of a drive from the city center they offer a shuttle to downtown for only 2.50 Euros one way per person. It was nice to stay there to get away from the busy city. Everything looks new and has a nice swimming pool area and 24 hour business center. The only thing I would mention is their restaurant. I would not recommend it. My family of five ate there for dinner one night and all the meals were not good at all. But their bar was fine. If you are stay in Rome, stay at the Holiday Inn but eat down town!

Reviews.Title: “14km from Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: rowdygirl
Reviews.Content: I, my husband and about 45 others stayed here as part of an Italian package tour over Easter 2012. The hotel itself is very nice. It is clean and updated. Our 3-course meals were provided as part of our package deal including a hot continental breakfast each morning. All were well prepared and nicely served. There were 'snacks' provided before dinner with the purchase of a beverage in the bar. The internet connection was expensive so we didn't bother with it. Our only other beef with the place was that it was 14km out of the city centre of Rome. However, it was a very easy, short (30 min) and inexpensive (1 Euro - train and subway combined) ride to get to downtown Rome from the Muratella station - just a short walk from the Holiday Inn. TO GET DOWNTOWN, you can purchase your train ticket at the desk at the hotel for 0.90 Euros. From the parking lot, turn left and walk along the fence past the garbage cans and towards the tracks. Then turn left for the platform. There is very little signage except the 'Muratella' sign at the station. The trains run about every 20 min. Get off at the Ostiense train station (4th stop) and walk to the Piramide Metro station along a series of indoor walkways. At Piramide, take the Rebibbia train to Termini (the central station downtown) using the same ticket. From there you can take a cab or get on a sightseeing bus or just walk to anywhere you want to go. TO GET TO THE HOTEL FROM DOWNTOWN (the Metro Termini station), buy your 1 Euro ticket at a tobacco shop, news stand or machine upstairs at the station. Take the B - Blue Metro line going towards Laurentina and get off at the 4th stop - Piramide. Walk to the Ostiense train station and find the correct track by looking at the schedules in the glass cases, probably Track 12. It will tell you the departure time (every 20 min or so). Make your way to the track and get off at the 4th stop, the Muratella station. Walk to the left (east) along the platform and continue along the chain link fence and past the garbage containers, soon you will see the hotel, the parking lot and the driveway entrance on the right. There is also a hotel shuttle to downtown for a fee. This hotel is very convenient to the Fiumicino (Da Vinci) Rome Airport and only took us about 10 minutes to get there. There is an airport shuttle as well. There is a nice bar area and a patio area with a pool. I would definitely stay here again if I were flying in or out of Rome. However, if I were planning on spending time in the city, I would prefer a hotel within walking distance of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Charges”
Reviews.Author: Shahid T
Reviews.Content: Travellers should be aware that hotel staff charge them twice for the same stay. Staff charge travellers second time after they have left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: ramses2nd
Reviews.Content: You arrive in Rome on a late flight which has been delayed. The kids are tired and you then have to wait a whole hour for the baggage handlers to get your bags from the plane to the carousel. To cap it all, there's a queue at the car rental desk when you get there. This is where this Holiday Inn comes into its own. It's 10 minutes drive from the airport and straight up the main road into town, so you can't miss it. This was our second stay at the hotel and whilst it's maybe not the best choice if you're planning visiting Rome itself, would recommend it to anyone with a late night or early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: DavidGeorge126
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Rome Fiumicino a little too early to catch the hotel shuttle so we took the train to Muratella station, not difficult (8 Euros each). On arrival at Muratella it would have been useful to have some signage to direct us to the Holiday Inn (cross the tracks and go left, then take a right down a pathway). The hotel is of 70's vintage I would guess, big and in the middle of a business park. The hotel reception staff checked us in in a businesslike fashion, I can never understand why all of our passport details are required when the border guard at Fiumicino just waved us through without looking at our travel documents. I found the reception staff to be helpful but too involved in their processes to notice when trying to catch their attention. We went up to our room, with two double beds (I had understood from their website that a family room would also include a sofabed - not so). My wife was disappointed to find that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Although the room was big by Italian standards, we had the perennial problem of keeping ourselves cool, it seems that the a/c doesn't become fully operational until later in the season (this was April), we resorted to keeping the window open which wasn't too successful and resulted in interrupted sleep. Outside was fairly quiet apart from the yelping from what I assume is a dog's refuge in the far distance, thankfully not in the middle of the night. We had a drink in the bar each evening where I am pleased to report that the staff were very friendly and pointed out that that on weekdays an "aperitivo" is served between 1800 and 2000, a cold finger buffet of snacks which our children enjoyed. The swimming pool looked very inviting but sadly this is not useable until June. The hotel is full of corporate hospitality during the week, many people wearing business suits attending conferences/seminars etc. We decided against using the hotel restaurant for dinner choosing instead to go to the Verde Smeralda situated a two minute walk behind the hotel. This is a very pleasant, informal Italian restaurant specialising, in very tasty pasta, pizza and steaks. The staff there speak good English, and we were looked after royally by Fabio, at a fraction of the cost of the Holiday Inn. I noticed that many of the residents of the hotel, especially families, came over each evening and I am grateful to the Trip Advisor reviewer who pointed this out. We took two shuttles into Rome, the service is very good at 3.50 Euros per person per journey (7 euros return). Buy the tickets from reception before you leave, the bus was never more than a third full and it drops you at via Petroselli, very central for walking around Rome. I had to take the shuttle bus to the airport to collect a rental car, I was a little surprised to learn that this service is free from the airport to hotel, but costs 2.50 Euros to go back to the airport. Breakfast was of a reasonable standard, not as good as British or American Holiday Inns but fine by the standards I have experienced in other Italian hotels, the scrambled eggs were not that appetising. Overall, this was a good choice of hotel, the price was very competitive, the location was fine thanks to the excellent shuttle service to town. The biggest drawback was the warmth of our room so I would return when it is either colder, or warmer and the a/c is operating... and when the pool is open so that the kids can use it, and we can enjoy a cup of tea in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pbaronde
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very good and attractive. in the beautiful area, the environment of the room makes it more pleasant. Just wanted to say Its Outstanding....

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Rome- Eur Parco Dei Medici”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. I read the complaints of it being outdated, but didn't find them justified. My family and I stayed here as it was close to the airport for a next morning flight. The provide transportation to the airport @ $2.50 euro/each. You need to check with the desk for departure times. I paid for the breakfast with the room and thought it was a good selection and tasty. They offered free parking and a free workout facility. The do not offer free internet. The only drawback to the place was their air conditioning was not turned on per the hotel front desk. We stayed in March and it was warm in our room, so I tried to turn the air on, but it didn't operate. I opened the window to cool the room off, but I would have preferred air as the outside was a little noisy. I would definitely recommend the hotel as a nice stay at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrTall_99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in Rome. Specifically chose it for quick getaway to airport. There arevshuttles to town and to airport and taxis if needed are there within 5 mins. Good room, nice space, proper shower, would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We gave up a few years ago”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 4 years in a row and would always leave from Fiumicino- We gave up after about 4 tries as the A?C does not work 2-Food is terrible-Even pizza was frozen The only nice part of this hotel is sitting outsie near the pool to relax and read before flying home Hotel needs a complete remodeling and I agree with most that the rooms are noisy- This is not a place to stlay once you find other choices. We now stay in the city and pay the taxi to take us to the airport and at least those two nights are pleasant-

Reviews.Title: “Starting to Fall Apart”
Reviews.Author: grm72
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and have been going to this hotel for a number of years. I would warn you that it is starting to fall apart and cleaning staff is having a hard time keeping up. Say away from rooms that face the pool since they are very hot all day and night (even in the winter). The front staff is also starting to loose its 'charisma' if you make a request make sure that you double check with them because they tend to forget and not pass along the message between day and night front desk managers. Don't expect a well balanced breakfast you will find a limited assortment of oily bacon scrambled eggs and a few pastries. This is a good hotel for working in the outskirts of Rome or if you are traveling to Rome on a budget. Transportation The city bus is not well connected. I never took their shuttle buss but always seems to be a mess. Taxi If you want to save 2-3 Euro don't call for a taxi at the front desk walk outside the front gate turn left and get the taxi (1 min walk). If you call the cab drives 100 feet but seem to turn on the meter a few minutes before to run up the bill then comes in to pick you up. Upside The rooms are big by Italian standards. Therefore a family of 4 can fit into a room without major problems. During the summer the pool is nice for kids but why would you go to Rome to sit at the pool in the outskirts of the city? Also the gym is decent (again by Italian standards) decent cardio equipment poor with weights. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Soul-less conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: FourFishFingers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a business district and, in my opinion is unsuitable for tourists. It caters for large groups and conferences - so be warned, it could be very busy. In my case, the location was convenient. My room was spacious but totally devoid of any charm whatsoever. The bed was comfortable, but that's about as far as the positives go. The decor of the room was bland and the furniture basic but functional. The carpet was badly worn, very faded and in dire need of replacement. The bathroom was clean but very old fashioned and the shower was distinctly low-pressure. Overall, the room was thoroughly depressing. There was a mini-bar, but no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The doors, walls and windows offer little to no soundproofing. I especially enjoyed my neighbour singing a lullaby at about 11pm one evening, though it didn't help me drift off to sleep. Less enjoyable was the constant flow of conference-related bus traffic entering/leaving the car park - which seemed to require one or more blasts of their horn, even at night. Also worthy of note is that you can hear every sound from the neighbouring bathroom. Another reviewer commented that the hotel feels like a converted hospital - I didn't believe it until I stayed there. It really does! Would I stay here again? Not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “You have been warned ...”
Reviews.Author: chelsjc
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with a number of reviews I read of this hotel, and am deeply disappointed that after filing a complaint with Priority Club and the ICHotel Group to find out that a number of people over a considerable period of time have been complaining on TripAdvisor about the same issues. For those lured in by the promise of an airport shuttle, be warned: It runs sporadically or sometimes not at all. If you don't catch the shuttle at the appointed time, which runs less than half a dozen times a day from the airport, you will have to shell out anywhere from 30 to 40 euros for a taxi one way. The hotel will offer NO assistance in the shuttle service, saying it is an contractor. It also says it advertises on the holidayinn Web site that it is a limited service. This is not true, and for folks expecting a certain level of service from a Holiday Inn/ICHG property ... well, check your expectations at the door at this hotel. Also, please note that the bus to and from Rome's city center is oversold and runs on a first come, first serve basis. Even if you have purchased a roundtrip ticket for 5 euro, you can be turned away. Again, the hotel takes no responsibility. The hotel staff was dismissive about issues with the shuttle, and refused to allow us out of our reservation to find a more convient, better located hotel that did not falsely advertise an airport shuttle... telling me that it noted the shuttle service was timed, etc., on its Web site. As you can see from the number of complaints, that's false. It also lacks the basic room amenities that one expects with a Holiday Inn overseas, such as a kettle, etc. I would suggest that you look elsewhere for a hotel if you are planning to use the hotel as a jumping off point to tour Rome. There are better options in the city center, and the taxi rate is about the same.

Reviews.Title: “HOlidayInn at PARCO DE MEDICI”
Reviews.Author: Sachin-guy375
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old property and since it is in a business district travellers can expect less service from the front desk. Breakfast is great with so many staff helping you. Rooms are old and bathrooms need repairs. Location is ok. Nothing really nearby to eat or go out.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel - To avoid”
Reviews.Author: thierry m
Reviews.Content: The very first thing I expect from an hotel is to be quiet so that I can sleep.. And my room was all but quiet. First, you can hear what is going on in the corridor: the door of the room is not sound proof. Second, the sliding window frames are in aluminium as usually installed back in the 70's. You have the impression that there is no window when you hear some outside noise. When the garbage trucks are in the street along the hotel, you feel like if the window was open and you were standing close to the trucks. I could not get a wink of sleep. When I registered (8th of nov 2011), the receptionist asked me whether it was my first time in the hotel. I said yes. I guess he gave me a noisy room because I was not a regular customer. But he can be sure, I will never become one. An hotel to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Location for a Holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1505
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a basic Holiday Inn. It is out of the city on the other side of the airport but they have very cheap shuttle in and out of the city. This allows you to hire a car and get around because they also have parking onsite. Brilliant family hotel with the garden and pool area as the kids can run free and burn off some energy. Because it is out of town you are not paying the expensive prices for a hotel. It is in a business area but the gardens around the pool with fences you don't really notice make up for it. The restaurant is basic and the menu items are simple. This is great for families as the meals are not over done or too way out for the kids to enjoy. The breakfast is a very good smorgesboard as per usual in Europe so it is a good start to the day. The staff are very courteous and caring in the restuarant trying hard to assist you in any way possible. A good conference hotels for business as they seem to have the conference rooms, break out rooms and special little places near the poolside for morning tea and lunchs. Generally the rooms are of a good size and are clean. Some aspects may seem a little dated but all seem to be in working order as well as clean. The gym is tiny but it doesn't seem too many people use it so it is adequate. The sauna is also small but work very well, is well lit and is clean. You actually lay out of the hotel is large spaces that are kept neat and tidy. The little gift shop is very well stock with a lot of items at a range of prices. It also does the little snacks, newspapers and bathroom items you may have forgotten. The staff are friendly and are very lay back in their manner so it calms the mood of the whole hotel. Overall, a brilliant hotel if you do not want to stay in the heart of the city or want to pay the very expensive prices. Week stayed for a week travelling in and out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Type Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magicdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as other Holiday Inns (which are nearer) to Rome Centre didnt have any spare family rooms. This is a typeical business hotel, nothing special. Forget the shuttle it only runs to town 5-6 times a day. The same goes of the airport shuttle. The good news is that there is a train station at the back of the hotel with a regular service to downtown Rome. We bought a Roma card which makes things easier (hotel doesnt sell them) when we got to Rome. Even though it was October room was hot. Air Con was not effective.

Reviews.Title: “Below avg room, poor location - wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: deeps-g
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010, I did not have a car and the hotel claimed that it had shuttle service near tourist attractions and that it was near a train station. Easy transportation was the primary reason to stay there. I was a bit disappointed because they dont have a shuttle schedule printed on their website, once you get there you realize that it is not very feasible to use, and secondly the train station is a bit of a walk, the road to the hotel has no lights and is stranded, I was very uncomfortable walking alone at night to/from the hotel to train station, day time wasnt a problem As for the hotel rooms, they seemed pretty dingy and seemed like it was converted from an old hospital. Lobby area was decent. There is nothing near by, so forget about walking somewhere to get dinner, you either have to get a cab or eat at the hotel restaurant. At least it had a shuttle to the airport, which I was able to use I wasnt impressed with their hotel rooms or the location, so I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop off before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: coaltownjack
Reviews.Content: very nice modern hotel rooms nice size but luggage space limited. No tea / coffee making facilties in room very nice restaurant and good selection for breakfast advertises free airport shuttle but does not mention set times available we would have had 3 hour wait so took taxi 100 euros with tip BE WARNED Shuttle into Rome at set times at 2.50 euros PP each way excellent value book return tickets in hotel early as it fills up fast

Reviews.Title: “FrontDesk has problems recognizing Elite Member of Priority Members...”
Reviews.Author: CMMAK
Reviews.Content: I had a good deal in terms of rates and that suits me fine. I was using it as a hub between Naples & Florence. I agree that the front desk has issues recognizing elite members from priority club ( I am Platinum Member). Very poorly informed about the PC membership. Have you expectation set right and you should be okay... This hotel does not provide coffee/tea making facility unless you ask! That is strange to me, because florence & naples' hotel provide them. It is far from town (around 25km) but easy to get train or local shuttle service. I have no issues with this. I spent 7 days here and I did enjoyed the stay... not the initial encounter with the front desk. The GM is very prompt to revert on issues, I suggest to drop him a note asap... don't wait until the end of stay. The culture in Italy is that make sure that the highest authority hears you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and suited our purpose”
Reviews.Author: Grace080
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Holiday Inn for one night after a cruise and before an extended road trip. This hotel is on the outskirts of Rome but near the airport. We had planned to go into the city and because there were 5 of us, we would have needed 2 cabs so we opted for the less expensive shuttle. The shuttle was great but if it had 6 runs into the city instead of only 4 would have been better. Also the last shuttle out of Rome back to the hotel was just after 8 pm, so maybe a 9:30 or 10 pm departure back to the hotel would have better suited a tourist's needs. The hotel itself was great; very North American style, great amenities, nice size bathroom, comfy beds, tv. Breakfast was included with our bill and it was very good. Lots of nice choices of fruits, juices, rolls, eggs, bacon, cappuccino. It was in a beautiful solarium. Overall a pleasant stay, and wonderful personnel at the check in desk.

Reviews.Title: “taking advantage”
Reviews.Author: carefit11
Reviews.Content: Last day of vacation. Chose this hotel because when we emailed them they told us they had free shuttle to airport. At check in they told me there was no early shuttle and they charge to take you to the airport. Had to take a cab. 53 euros!!!! for a 10 minute trip. Dinner was 35 euros each for the cheapest choice and all 3 of us agreed it was terrible. $215.11 for dinner for 3 and a cab ride. This did not include the room. Had to pay for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient ...”
Reviews.Author: sharonsumy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn/Euro Parco Dei Medici for one night after a cruise. It is very clean, a good front-desk staff who were very helpful and large, comfortable rooms. There is a large buffet breakfast for 16 Euros, although we only wanted a cup of coffee and they charged us accordingly. They have a shuttle service into and back from Rome as well as a shuttle to the airport. Each way is 2.50Euros (however, if you are coming from the airport, the shuttle is free). You can also get into Rome on the local train ... a 5-minute walk from the hotel. The gift shop in the hotel sells the tickets. When we left for the airport the next day, it was a 10 minute ride right to the international departure terminal. Would definitely stay here again when we have a short layover.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for conferences and bussiness”
Reviews.Author: Turista2011054
Reviews.Content: I've spend last week-end in this hotel for an international conference and I had an wonderful time there in terms of comfort, hotel amenities, restaurant. I want to mention specially the room very comfortable and the huge bed with no more and no less the 4 cushions. Very cosy. The continental breakfast was plenty and of good quality. The hotel has his own shuttle for transport to/from airport and city center, which is a very good thing. I recomend the hotel first of all for bussiness trips but could be ok also for turism even is a little far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have no other choice”
Reviews.Author: LengraMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early afternoon after a long drive from Sorrento on a very hot day and were looking forward to a swim in the hotel pool. As we were checking in we noticed a small sign saying the pool was closed due to a cocktail party being held there later in the evening. We complained to the check in staff and were ignored . They were too busy chatting to each other than worrying about complaints. There was not even an apology or the offer of a complimentary drink, anything would have been nice to compensate for the inconvenience . This hotel is not up to our standard. Service is non existant. The prices of the hotel restaurants and internet services are horrendous. The ice machine on our floor was out of order and the rooms were tired as was the carpet. We found a nice little restaurant around the corner that served good food at reasonable rates. The following morning we decided to pay the ridiculous amount of 16 euros for breakfast and were horrified when we asked for coffee to have the waiter almost throw the cups on the table. The fact that we are priority club members meant nothing to the staff. We will never stay at this hotel again and will think twice about staying at any Holiday Inn in the future. The room was large and the bed comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: frufrusue
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Holiday Inn after a day of travelling. My kids were excited to cool off in the pool, but when we went to get towels 45 minutes before the pool closed the attendant said that there were none left and that the pool was closing. The hotel is located out of the main area of Rome. I would only suggest it if you need a place to sleep before heading to the airport and get a good deal online.

Reviews.Title: “1 day layover”
Reviews.Author: hrcalso
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to stay for one night on a layover. They offered shuttle service from the airport. Cost to pay for, 3 months in advance was 88E. It was close to the airport. Because I was limited on my walking ability I did not check the area around. Looking out my window did not show much as other stores and rest. First of all the Rome airport is about the poorest one with signs to show you where to go to get to the hotel shuttles. THERE is none. Go past T3 another 10 minutes and you will see support beams for the road above. That is where they are located at. The Holiday inn shuttle only comes every 1 1/2 -2 hours and is not a 24 hr service. They charge you to take you back to the airport. It is a very small amount of 2.5E. They meals for room service is very high. The meals in the restaurant are very high for what you get, in my opinion. Maybe par for course for Rome. Room amendities were outrageous for me. 27e for 24hr full internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Celia P
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of advance booking and got a great deal. this hotel is perfect for the last day before your flight. We took the 8:30 am shuttle to the airport in a comfortable and on-time small bus. Easy! The bed was firm and super comfortable with a cozy down comforter. I got a great nights sleep. The swimming pool was large and they hand you an oversized heated towel to dry yourself with after your swim. It was luxurious. The restaurant is attractive but the food is mediocre. Overall a great last night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: bonchien
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because we had a one night lay over in Fiumicino. We booked because of the free shuttle and prepaid for a room with breakfast. Upon arrival we learned the only the shuttle to the hotel is free and the hotel charges 2.50 EU per person to go from the hotel to the airport. As other reviewer's report, the on-site restaurant is expensive and there's no other restaurants nearby. The hotel charges 14 EU for wifi, clearly they are getting everything they can from customers. The room was nice in an American hotel kind of way, meaning two normal size double beds, a huge bathroom for Europe, TV, etc. Felt like we got back to the first world (Sorry Italy, but many of your hotels would be considered hostels in the US). All was good until a lady arrived in the room next door and started talking to her Mama on the phone. The walls were paper thin, and the lady next door wasn't talking to Mama softly. We had to wear ear plugs to get to sleep. The breakfast was good, bigger than a normal European breakfast, but not outstanding. Overall I would say the hotel is okay, but I would only stay here if I had an overnight at the airport or business nearby. Otherwise, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: un-viaggio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 2 nights before flying out of Rome. The hotel has recently been refurbished and our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The pool area is nice and a great way to finish the day after sightseeing in Rome. We took the shuttle service both to the airport and Rome. We had the buffet at the hotel restaurant which was well presented and a good choice of food. The restaurant staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn should have their sign removed”
Reviews.Author: ricci1999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitly big and located conveniently close to many businesses and a good gateway to the airport. But they milk that. They are not at the standard of other Holiday Inn's worldwide. They seem to be understaffed, everywhere we experiences long waits, fromthe reception, at pretty much any time in the day, to the restaurant. the gym is a huge anti-climax. And your Platinum Priority Club membershup is worth as much as a bus ticket in this hotel - no upgrade, no special assistance or concierge, and I am quite sure, they didn't even put the points on my account -as they scribbled my number on some flakey piece of paper

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: LouiseG66
Reviews.Content: Although it was out of town the connections to the airport and city were really good via the shuttle bus and also the train station. The swimming pool was large and well kept. The breakfast and evening meals were very tasty. The kids enjoyed the evening buffet and we had an excellent steak (although not cheap). Staff were really friendly and helpful. Don't get a taxi to the hotel though...it cost 60 euros, twice as much as the hotel site advised.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgadan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you need to stay a night or 2 in Rome to catch a flight. The rooms are clean and the service is generally efficient. Airport access is good with regular shuttles (2.50 euro per person). It is fairly easy to access central Rome using public train/metro system if you want to spend a few hours in the city itself. Otherwise, there is not much else to do around the hotel. The only negative is that the food in the restaurant is overpriced and very bad. The rooms have no safe boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamapafi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for 2 nights with my wife and 3 kids. The hotel is nice, rooms are clean and tidy, however exactly the samr, you can find anywhere in the world. Nothing exciting. Staff is very helpfull and speaks good english. The breakfast is in a form of a buffe and you pay 16 euro for the adult - children are free. The only thing that annoyed me was that the internet access through hotel WiFi is charged extra per hour. That in my view is radiculous for the 4 star hotel - these days even 2 or 3 stars hotels give WiFi access included.

Reviews.Title: “do-not-stay-here; ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: rvrtrips
Reviews.Content: This hotel ruined our trip. Do not stay here.. to start off, it's in the middle of nowhere. The train runs sporadically portions of the day so you can't get back to your hotel unless you are willing to spend 30 Euros on a cab. We spent most of our trip sitting at the train station than we did actually seeing Rome. The hotel charged for breakfast AND internet even though the package we purchased said everything was provided. I've stayed in better hotels for cheaper. The rooms were NICE, but everything else was horrible. As comparison at the Hard Rock of Rome I got 4 mixed drinks, 2 keeper glasses, 4 meals (one of which was the NY Strip steak) and paid the same amount as I did in the hotel restaurant for 2 pastas, a club sandwich with soggy french fries, a SKEWER of meat and 4 sprites. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere with no reliable consistent transportation and they know it when they charge for food at the hotel restaurant. And the pool closes at 8pm when the sun doesn't set until almost 10pm. sad... kids can't even go in the pool. This is the worst hotel I've stay at in Rome, and it ruined our trip. do not stay here. Oh, I almost forgot.. the reception lady screamed at someone, and another reception lady didn't even sell us tickets to the bus knowing we needed them.. sad service. And we are platinum priority club members at Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel, but not convenient to Rome City Center”
Reviews.Author: jtwiz
Reviews.Content: There were a lot of great things about the Holiday Inn, not the least of which was that it is walking distance to my company's office in Rome. If you have business in Parco Dei Medici, this hotel is definitely where you want to stay. While some other reviewers seemed to have issues with the airport shuttle bus, I did not. Upon my request, the hotel emailed me a pdf copy of the shuttle bus schedule and told me where to find it. The bus arrived approximately on time and exactly where I was told it would be. The bus is free from the airport to the hotel and is 2.5 Euros on the way back to the airport, or to Rome's city center. My corporate negotiated rate included the breakfast buffet, which was great. Hot dishes like eggs, bacon, sausage and pancakes were available along with fruits, sliced meats and cheeses, yogurt, pastries, etc. My room was large (contained 2 double beds, desk, and an additional seating area) and very clean. The bathroom was also nice-sized and spotless. They provided shampoo, shower gel, hand lotion and bar soap. There was a good-sized flat screen TV and a minibar. All the furnishings, carpet, etc. appeared to be pretty new. The hotel has a large, quite nice pool area. It was extremely inviting, with plenty of chairs and umbrellas. There are also outside seating areas, where my colleagues and I enjoyed a cocktail one night. The bar offers free snacks during "Happy Hour." As I was by myself the first night, I ate dinner in the hotel restaurant. While quite expensive, the food was good (not great...) and as a solo female traveler, it is very convenient to be able to dine within the property. The hotel was quite busy! The lobby always had groups coming and going. However, I found the front desk personnel to be very professional, knowledgeable and friendly regardless of how busy they always seemed to be. Beside the hotel restaurant being very expensive, the one downside to the hotel is how far it is from Rome's city center. A cab ride was about 25 Euros and a half hour depending on traffic. You can walk to the train station (about 1 block away at the rear of the industrial park) or catch the shuttle bus as an alternative. This hotel was perfect for doing business in Parco Dei Medici, but I would not use it as a base for a sight-seeing trip. All in all, my stay at the Holiday Inn was very nice and I would not hesitate to recommend it as a a good hotel for doing business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirleykouassi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Roma for business purposes and checked in this hotel as I was arriving late at the airport. It is not very far from the airport. It is located in a office building zone so very quiet area at neight as all offices are closed. The hotel is clean and nice. I had a room on the 2nd floor which was renovated so very modern. My colleague had a room on the 4th floor but view pool view, which is nice. Breakfast was nice, but not the best buffet I have ever seen. there is a shuttle bus to the airport and also to the city. Overall it was good but the staff could have been a bit more smiling and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KEE75
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel before our cruise from Civitavecchia after finding all other options in Rome, near the airport and Port were fully booked or much more expensive. It was much cheaper and nicer than our four star accommodation in the port. We had no trouble with the shuttle bus which was free from the hotel and were allowed to check in quite early which was appreciated after a long flight with young children. The train station was a short walk from the hotel and it was easy to get to Civitavecchia from there. The breakfast, included in the room cost, was great and had a good variety of foods including delicious pastries. We had not done much research about this hotel so were pleasantly surprised to find beautiful grounds, pools and a small playground which our children enjoyed. The only down side was the lack of eating options nearby, other than the hotel restaurant which was not cheap. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Borderline false advertising and will never stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAH777
Reviews.Content: They claim Free airport shuttle - Wrong. We got to the FCO airport to find out the shuttle stops by 4-5 times a day, we just missed the last one, and it's 4 hours until the next one. It cost us 31 euros to take a taxi to the hotel. And the shuttle back to the airport from the hotel is NOT FREE. They claim Free wi-fi -Wrong. Only the first hour is free, the next hour is 7 euros. 24 hours is 14 euros. We have an email confirming reservation that states Free breakfast - Wrong. It was free if we paid 16 euros each. We also had someone enter our room without knocking or anything while we were taking a nap. The person exiting when seeing our bags and we did not get a glimpse of them. The front desk denied that anyone could of enetered the room!!!!! The front desk people, especially Massimo, were especially condescending and just shrugged their shoulders when we brought these items up.

Reviews.Title: “A huge hotel packed with coach tours.”
Reviews.Author: tomppayne
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and tried to avoid this one, but was left no choice when rooms in city centre were upwards of €400 for a last minute business trip. I was put on the second floor which has just be done up. Rooms were huge and looked great. New beds so a great nights sleep. The location does suit local area business or the airport rather than the city centre. A taxi was around €30 to centre from hotel. Pool was a good size but half of gym machines were broken. The internet was also very expensive. The food was ok, but breakfast did offer a huge selection. Overall, I think once all floors have been upgraded this will be a nice place to stay, but the owners need to look after it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for Business in the Area”
Reviews.Author: Senegeser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business travelers working in the Parco Dei Medici area. It's clean and modern, the staff are very polite and helpful, and it's within walking distance of a lot of commercial office buildings. Note that the shuttle from the hotel to the airport is no longer free. It now costs 2.50 euro (much better than the taxi price, which is a little more than 10 times that at 26 euro). The shuttle from the airport to the hotel is still free, but I waited for it until about 10 minutes past the scheduled departure and it never showed up. It leaves from bus stop 14 at the airport - kind of a long walk from the airport exit. The most annoying thing about this hotel was that it attempts to cater to business travelers but then charges 14 euro per day for internet access. To me, in the year 2011, that's kind of like a hotel charging for hot water or electricity. All in all, though, I would recommend the place if you need to do business in the area or be close to the airport (about 15-20 minute drive). One other note - there are only a couple of restaurants near the hotel, and the hotel restaurant is quite expensive. Obviously, this is NOT a hotel for Rome tourists as it is quite a ways from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “INADEQUATE SHUTTLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: busterMaryland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every year before returning to the states. Overall the hotel is very nice and comfortable. The staff we found to be very helpful. I was lost driving back to the hotel late one night and the staff at the desk stayed on the phone with me and guided me back. The shuttle is nice but does not leave early enough in the morning to catch the early bird flights. The shuttle to the city is nice if you can get it but they need to leave more often and have a later return from the city. If you get back with the last shuttle there is nothing to do at the hotel. The pool closes early which is really sad for families who would like to relax after the heat of the day., The restaraunt is too expensive. There is nothing in walking distance. So the only thing you can do is watch tv. The shuttle should return 7,8,9,and 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fits in Budget - Far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: ShajiPT
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable , clean and big. The hotel is quite far from City Center. It costs around 22-28 Euros from City by taxi. There is a train station within walking distance and if you are traveling during day time I would recommend using Train. You will have to change train based how you want to get to the City [train or metro]. The staff advised us not to use the train after it gets dark. The breakfast was good which was included in the room cost. They charge extra for internet which we found very surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Limited in your choices if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: Wq949966
Reviews.Content: I stay a lot in Holiday Inn hotels so I know what to expect in terms of service and prices when I walk into one. But this was a surprise for me. Firstly I think the hotel is in desperate need of renovation and is showing its age. BUT it has the largest family rooms you will see in Italy! So for that reason alone (and price) it is not too bad. The "frequent shuttle" advertised in their site is not too frequent unless frequent to you means 4 times a day!. We took the train everywhere and it takes at least 40 minutes to get anywhere useful. You are NOT in Rome when you stay here! So be aware of that. The hotel restaurant was a big disappointment. The waiting staff was very good but the prices will surprise you! 16 euros for a soup and almost 8 euros service charge per person for room service making it 25 euros for a bowl of soup! I have paid less than half that at the intercontinental in Dubai. The prices were exorbitant and choice extremely limited. There is ONLY one restaurant close by and that too is nothing to get excited about. My biggest surprise was that for a hotel based in Rome and where most customers are there "to see Rome", the front desk staff was not engaging at all. No concierge at all and information only if you persist and at too with an attitude. On our last day the desk staff saw us walking in the lobby with all our luggage but made no attempt to ask if we wanted a taxi or any help. I was so put off that we walked outside to the taxi rank and hailed one for ourselves. The staff made me feel that I was interrupting them whenever i asked a question. I asked for a bus route map and after a lot of searching and shoulder shrugging I was given a black and white photocopied map of the metro (which is useless as it you cant see the colour of the lines).

Reviews.Title: “You can feel the sadness...”
Reviews.Author: Coraat2011
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum Priority Rewards Traveller, I've visited many IGH Hotels, from Milan to Ankara, from Frankfurth to Rome. What I have to say " Why some Italian Hotel of the Chain are o bad managed?" Why while entering these structures you can feel sadness at first sights? People working there they know very few about hospitality. The only goal that they reach is the guest feels UnWelkomed. I know thay can do better, if in other Countries, the same Hotels Chain has bullets to fire! Never again in this hotel. May be you can stand for a night but I do advice it for more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fit for our Needs”
Reviews.Author: NeroNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: Needed hotel relatively near Fiumicino and had the following: 1- free scheduled transportation airport/hotel, 2- free scheduled transportation hotel/rome center, 3- free parking, 4- easy access to autostrada and close to Fiumicino. The Holiday Inn was a perfect match. One in our party arrived Rome early am from the states and used the hotel shuttle to the hotel and into Rome for the day. We arrived early evening, picked up the car, drove to hotel, met up, and got out of town the next day. The hotel is quite nice, which was a pleasant surprise. Food in the restaurant is very expensive, even for Europe, with a bowl of soup being 14 Euros. If you looking for a hotel in Rome, this isn't it!! But it's a great choice for an overnight with the excellent transportation and the cost was comparible to more expensive places, which changed extra for shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “The worst food in Europe”
Reviews.Author: bazaletto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst food of any hotel restaurant I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Franknap
Reviews.Content: Not bad this place, a bit of a pain getting the bus. But it was cool mingling with the locals. Great shops down the block. Across the street is a nice little pizzeria where you wait for the bus. Dont wait for the bus in the front! It comes on the side of the hotel. Get tickets from front desk(when they have them) or go to the gas station right outside. Breakfast is great but a bit pricey, dinner wasnt bad either. Cheap drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Holiday Inn... we found”
Reviews.Author: paulnpaula
Reviews.Content: As stranded in Rome after being dumped by BA late and missing our connecting flight to Malta we had to find somewhere - Hilton wanted over £250 for a night and this hotel offered half that price and a free shuttle. Shuttle had stopped operating, taxi took us (and stole a bag) and the hotel was our ocean in calm! Had a late dinner and selection of food was limited to put it mildly - quality was good but portins were inadequate - €15 for a lasagna that has cost me €8 in a quality restaurant in Rome city centre. Being stranded, we needed to keep up with plans and hotel did offer on hour free wifi - but needed to pick up an email when had used the hour and was told that would have to buy another one! After having experienced Holiday Inn throughout the UK, this was a disappointment! High cost - not matched by service! Staff were great - but the Manager must have got out of the wrong side of the bad!

Reviews.Title: “SOOOO UNHAPPY!”
Reviews.Author: centcar
Reviews.Content: My experience was not a happy one. The bathroom was NOT clean. Hair was found in the bathtub. The hotel shuttle was so full going back to the hotel that a brawl broke out and so we paid to return rather than risk bodily injury. The staff was unconcerned about clean pool towels for my freezing little nephew.....Very surprised by our experience at a HOLIDAY INN!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Victorjuliet
Reviews.Content: If you run out of options, you can take a look at this place. The rooms are neat and tidy and well maintained. Good and comfortable bed. For the price you pay, it is value for money, but definitely there is ample scope of improvement. Breakfast buffet is a great option with good choice. Restaurant food - not too many options or variety of cuisines (unless they have introduced some in the last few months) Swimming pool is fine. But other amenities are average. The reception staff are not very tourist friendly, so beware !!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot believe Holiday Inn allows their name on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasNativetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Rome since we needed to head to the airport fairly early. Our room was a total dump. The only saving grace was that the bathroom was clean and the linens were clean. I have never been so thankful to have spare shower shows with me. The carpet was absolutely filthy- solid dirt and grease from the room door to another 6 feet into the room. Had I not been staying on Holiday Inn points and had a free stay, I would have probably complained. We used the free shuttle to the airport and arrived downstairs 30 minutes early for the shuttle. Unbenounced to us, the hotel had a large group staying at the hotel and was transporting them to a conference facility near the airport. We came very close to not being able to get on the shuttle ( because we had to deal with getting the luggage stowed under the bus and all the conference goers piled onto the bus). It would have been helpful if the front desk had told us of the estra shuttle riders the night before when we asked for the shuttle schedule. I read other review about a breakfast, we were not offered a breakfast. Like others stated, the hotel is in an office park. There was one restaurant in walking distance which was decent. However, we were a little nervous walking there given the industrial area and dim lighting, we were not sure how safe the area was. When we were waiting for the shuttle the next morning, we noticed a group of Americans on a tour checking in. My husband and I felt so bad for them that they were staying at such a dump that was so far outside of the city. It look us a solid 45 minutes to get to this hotel from out other hotel that was near the Vatican. The hotel proudly displays an award at the front counter for "most improved" or "best remodel" or something to that effect. Whoever granted that award must not have never visited the hotel. Two star only because the linens were clean. Otherwise, the rooms were comprable to an old Motel 6 near a truck stop.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Holiday Inn.”
Reviews.Author: sandytoez
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. Suited our purpose though as it had a free shuttle into town that we took to Rome one evening. Nice pool area as well with nice seating around a lovely courtyard. Room was basic and clean with good air conditioning as it sure was needed. Rome is hot and humid. Nice little shop in the lobby. Not very many choices in dining around the area so you are limited to the hotel restaurant which is pricey. but then again, the shuttle is handy. Close to airport. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here.”
Reviews.Author: MadeByMark
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor, and feel this is the first time Trip Advisor steered us wrong. This is a dingy, dated, isolated little hotel with a disagreeable staff and limited, expensive services. We cannot recommend it to anyone at any price. At more than 20 minutes from the airport, this can hardly be called an airport. There are no restaurants or shops nearby, so be prepared to eat any meals at the hotel grill, which charges eight Euro for frozen pizzas and twelve Euro for frozen lasagna. (Know also that the restaurant has limited hours, so if you arrive hungry in the afternoon or evening, you are likely to have no option other than the ham and cheese sandwich served at the bar.)  The business center does provide computers, but a credit card is required to use them, and you will pay thirty-five cents a minute and thirty-five cents per printed page when using any of these PCs. To add insult to injury, you are charged for the time required to sign on to the system and enter your billing information. You will spend between seventy-five cents and a Euro just for the privilege of telling the hotel how to bill your session. Our non-smoking room reeked of stale cigarette smoke. Sheets were clean, but that is the only positive thing I can say for the otherwise dingy, faded room, where even the wall paper puckered at the seams. The air conditioner was also broken. Finally, be aware that the "free" airport shuttle operates according to a very rigid, inflexible, and inconvenient schedule. If you arrive very early, you may wait hours for it, and if you depart earlier than 7:00 (when the shuttle makes its first run) you must do so by taxi, which will cost between $40 and $50 Euro, depending on the honesty of the driver. I would have rather invested that money in comfortable and serviceable hotel room nearer the airport!  Disappointing, dingy, and depressing. Make another choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really good, although restaurant was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hursley
Reviews.Content: Spacious quiet room, surprisingly good garden and pool with bar and lunch service. Good access to motorway network around Rome. However, the hotel is in a business park and there are no restaurants within walking distance. Hence it was disappointing to experience the limited choice and overpriced offerings in the hotel restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MJ26
Reviews.Content: A quality, comfortable air-conditioned hotel with shuttles to/from the Rome airport and to/from city center of Rome. Also within walking distance of the train. Perfect for a quick stop-over visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Fiumicino Airport”
Reviews.Author: BetelgeuseIndia
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and is part of the Holiday Inn Chain, so one can take a bare minimum quality of service for granted. Staff at the reception are very courteous. In terms of security too, the hotel scores well especially since a lot of foreigners have lost their luggages from the hotel lobbies. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is close to the Fiumicino Airport. From the airport, you need to reach the Grand Raccordo Annulare (the Ring Road) and continue on the Exit No. 33. The hotel is on the left hand side (bright neon signs of "Holiday Inn") on display. Taxi from the airport costs between 30-33 Euros. The hotel is self sufficient in terms of restaurants and coffee shops. It has complimentary shuttle services both to the city centre (near the Victor Emanuel II Monument) and the airport. Hence if you are aware of the timings (from the reception) you can save considerable sums of money in traveling within Rome or to the airport when you are taking the flight out. The restaurants and bar at the hotel are good. The breakfast spread in the morning is excellent living up to the reputation of Italy being a gourmet's paradise. Find the hotel very conveniently located. Should appeal to both the business and the leisure traveller. Wifi is available at the lobby and at the rooms at nominal charge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & sober hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhandarkar123
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel with good rooms. No tea/ coffee maker in the room. The central AC was switched off but opening the windows at night made the rooms comfortable. Food was decent too. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good family and business hotel outside Rome centre”
Reviews.Author: Petales88
Reviews.Content: We were at this Holiday Inn outside Rome centre for just one night as it suited our purpose. Arriving late at night, this hotel is easy to access by car and has ample free parking. We were 2 adults and 3 children and they allowed us to share a room, paying just an extra 12 euros for my teenager's breakfast the next day. The room was big, clean and comfortable. It has 2 double beds and a good-sized bathroom. If I had wanted to save money and am ready to drive into Rome everyday or take the hotel's shuttle, I would stay at this hotel. As it was, we had planned to stay a few nights in the centre of Rome itself which if you can afford it is really worth it. I could therefore not understand why people who chose to stay outside Rome should complain about the Holiday Inn's shuttle service or its distance from the city centre. You want to be near the sights you stay in Rome. You want a good-sized room for a lower price, eventually a pool for the hot afternoons and a good breakfast, and preferably have a car, stay at the Holiday Inn. The buffet breakfast was in an airy and bright room at the lobby. The spread was good and has almost everything that you'll need. The service was a little brusque but they were fast. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: tsilisGreece
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel.we went there on easter days two adults two children.allthough the hotel was full the stuff was very friendly and we had an excellent service.location is not veryeasy if you don ot have a car.the hotel has coaches to transfer you to the city center and to the airport at specific hours.breakfast and dinner are highly recommended.we are frequent travellers and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “think twice before you choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_and_G_2008
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because it is closed to the airport. As we fly into Roma at late evening from Palermo and will leave for home early next day, we choose this one thinking that Holiday Inn should be ok. Yet ... the room is not safe, the window can't be locked and making you felt so unsafe at night. the cleanliness of the room & bathroom is so so .... Worst thing is that they have only one restaurant. We were starving when we arrived at the hotel around 9:30pm as we had no time to grab something to eat at the airport so as to catch the free hotel shuttle. However, this one & only one restaurant served only buffet dinner at Euro 28 per person. Unbelievable! Moreover, everywhere is a trap .. if you take out a can of coke from the fridge, your room will be charged no matter you drive it or not. If you press a wrong button on the TV, your room will be charged. Be careful if you touch anything in the room if you stay there. So pressurized.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the centre, but excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: mikivoyageur
Reviews.Content: The only inconvenient was thet the hotel was located quite far from the centre, but the train station is at least not far from the hotel. At the same time it was quite nice also to be far from the chaotic centre of Rome. It seemed we arrived into an osasis of peace. The staff were so nice and the rooms were excellent, spacious, very roomy and cozy at the same time. It's a perfect option for a long stay in Rome... Like that you'll have time to enjoy the wonderful pool they've got!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay...not great.”
Reviews.Author: Utah_Doanes
Reviews.Content: My husband had to stay at this hotel for a business trip. I accompanied him thankfully knowing that this hotel was not close to the center of Rome. The hotel itself was clean and our room was actually quite large. We found some of the staff were friendly, and others were pretty crabby. Their website states that the rooms come with an iron and ironing board, however the only thing we found was a pants press mounted to the wall that was pretty useless. We paid for the week long WiFi which was 45 EUR.....what a rip, but it worked fine and we never had any connection issues. Housekeeping was great, and we always returned to a clean room. My biggest beef with the hotel (and it might seem petty) was that there were no vending machines anywhere. If you wanted a drink (even bottled water ) you had to order it at the bar or through room service and it was 4.10 EUR per bottle. Also, there is no place within walking distance of the hotel to get any type of drinks or snacks. The hotel's food was mediocre at best and extremely overpriced. There is only one restaurant within walking distance, and it wasn't much better. While it is true that this hotel is NOT near the center of Rome, it is very, very easy (and inexpensive) to take public transportation to pretty much anywhere you want to go. The Magliana train station is an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel where you can take the train into town. Don't bother with a taxi because it can sometimes take longer due to traffic. A taxi will cost about 25-30 EUR from the hotel to Piazza Novona, where a 7 day CIS ticket is 16 EUR and is good on the trains, buses, trams, and metro. If we were to go back from Rome and could choose where we wanted to stay, it would definitely be someplace closer to the heart of the city. But if you're looking for someplace near the airport, it's not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Business hotel only”
Reviews.Author: Stevep5553
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near to FCO in a business park and not in Rome, no bars / restuarants nearby to visit so you get trapped in the hotel and their expensive prices. Hotel shuttle in infrequent and overloaded at peak times so you often have to use Taxis. Rooms are showing their age and in need of refurbishment. Only any use as a airport stopover hotel if you get a good price and even then you will get caught by Bar/ Restaurant or Internet charges only use if the company is paying. Rooms are dated but clean although I was originally given a smoking room that stank.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad an accomodation”
Reviews.Author: junollie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with four other couples, stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights to start off our Med cruise. Despite the negative reviews about this hotel we still decided to book since it was the best location and best value for our money, solely banking on the Holiday Inn standard - and we were glad we did. The rooms and facilities were clean and modern, the staff were really nice and helpful, and the shuttle to the city and airport was a real plus, although at one time we did try the train, the station being just a mere 5-min walk from the hotel. The trip to the city takes only about 20 min. and you get dropped off right by the Roman Forum. For the additional $6, the breakfast buffet was a real deal - food was great - coffee simply the best. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MelissaInAU
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in October 2009 with children aged 6 and 11. This hotel was such a disappointment and really affected our stay. The room itself was fairly standard Holiday Inn stuff. Not great, not bad - just average. Two double beds - except that one didn't have any blanket on it! By the time we noticed, our children were asleep and we didn't want to risk waking them, so we had to wait until the next day to do anything about it. Meanwhile, the phones in our room didn't work (high-pitched whine when you picked them up) and nor did the heater/air conditioner. And there was no plug for the bath. Requests for extra pillows and an extra blanket were met with eye-rolls. The staff were not very helpful - for example, when we asked about public transport tickets and whether we could use ours, they didn't know the answer. The location is dreadful - it really is miles away from Rome. Worse, though, are the instructions on their website - they tell you to take the Metro line B to a particular station and then catch the bus from there. We did this, to the letter, and it took us NEARLY TWO HOURS to get there from Termini station. When we asked at reception, we were told that we were wrong and we should have caught a different train. Hard to know when you're just following instructions from the hotel's website! I wish we had just caught a taxi instead. There is a different station close to the hotel, but it can be hard to find your way to the station as you have to walk through scrub to get there. The Holiday Inn promises that "kids eat free" but this does not apply at this hotel unless you order a full 3-course meal from the very expensive menu - pasta does not count as a main meal. Of course, no-one explained this to us until the THIRD time we complained about being charged for the kids' meals. Internet access was available (very expensive, even by european standards) but we found that it kept dropping out. Our stay here really was dreadful. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient shuttle”
Reviews.Author: jwon
Reviews.Content: Overall not a bad place. They advertise 24 hr shuttle service but it's very spotty and infrequent. We missed the shuttle from the airport so had to wait another 2 hours. The earliest shuttle to the airport from the hotel is at 7am and the driver will only drop everyone off at Terminal 3 which almost caused us to miss our flight back to the US. We were using the hotel for the day before and he day after our 12 day cruise. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: reb6a
Reviews.Content: I spent a week on business in this dreadful hotel and my wife joined me for the weekend. I had to ask front desk to get me a clean room that did not have live crickets singing and dancing around the room to ensure that the weekend was peaceful. We normally enjoy staying in Holiday Inn Hotels and this hotel was a poor reflectin on what we believe is a reputable brand name. Pool closed 1st October even though temperatures were still in access of 25 / 26 degrees. Poor quality service from staff, there was a general apathy about the quality and standards of care for customers. Food (breakfast exempt from this comment) was very poor - it is unimaginable to think that in Italy a lasagna is inedible!!! The keys to our room frequently lost thier ability to gain entry into our room and we had to make many trips back to reception to get a new one. On the day we were leaving staff tried to enter our room to clean it at 8.30 in the morning - extrodinary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PeterCal
Reviews.Content: Darling wife and I needed to find a hotel for one evening prior to going on an extended cruise from Civitavecchia. Back in April when we booked this hotel there were a series of great reviews for this property and we take these reviews seriously when making travel decisions. Then, around August and September a number of negative reviews came forward and I was thinking of canceling our reservation. They talked about dirty rooms, flat old pillows, old worn mattresses, rude staff, etc. Shocking stuff. I am very happy I did not cancel. The hotel is very clean and well run The rooms are very large by European standards and everything was very pleasant, from check-in to check-out. The breakfast buffet is especially a treat and it seemed to be very popular with all the hotel guests. The restaurant is large and it was packed. Lots of different foods to chose from. I cannot think of one negative thing to write down, unless you wanted it to be located in the center of Rome, which it is not! A friend stayed at one of those "center of Rome" hotels and paid three times what we paid. Also, their room looked like a closet in comparison to our room. BTW the pictures posted look exactly like our room looked. We high recommend the Holiday Inn- Eur Parco Dei Medici. Peter & Annmarie

Reviews.Title: “Good stop over stay in Rome. Eat at Verde Sheraldo resaurant while here.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaCantravel
Reviews.Content: We flew into Rome from Toronto and stayed here our first night. We were tired and used this hotel as our first night near the airport to rest and get ready for the Rome tours the next day. Its too far from Rome for using as a base. its in a business area. A free shuttle goes from the airport to the hotel but check the schedule as its only every couple hours. We waited 1.5 hours for our shuttle. We arrived and got our room. Clean and nice. The pool was cool ( as in cold) and there is not much to do aruond the hotel. IN the morning we walked to the train station 5 minute walk down the street which took us to Rome central and our hotel for the remainder of the trip. RECOMMENDATION THOUGH: Eat at the restaurant behind the hotel called VERDE SHERALDO. Very reasonable prices and excellent food! Best food on the entire trip! We have beef and wife had pizza. Yummy! For desert we had a ready made ice cream which was delicious. We asked the front desk for recommendations and they recommended this placeAsk the front desk for directions. Its just around the corner from the Holiday Inn. They had a small gym with treadmill and bikes and a sauna. Empty. Machines were new. Sauna had sign showing how to have a euro sauna (nude). Was hoping to see a babe walk in but no such luck. Just me.;) The Bad: too many smokers in general in Rome/Europe which limited enjoyment of outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “fab service”
Reviews.Author: toshinaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for just a couple of days, after a week in sorrento it was a stop off before catching a flight back to the UK. We caught the hotel bus into the centre of Rome, did a bit of sight seeing and shopping. The hotel staff were super, really friendly. The hotel itself had a swimming pool that the kids enjoyed and a gym/sauna that my and husband and I got to enjoy. The breakfast was great, lovely fruit selection and kids loved the pancakes. The restaurant staff - Claudia in particular was brilliant, nothing was too much, he made my daughters laugh, he even cut up there food for them! Would definitely stay here again. PS Claudia your friends Danica & Monica say hello!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Katie227
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two children ages 9 and 11 one night on arrival and returned on our last night in Rome. Hotel was clean, rooms were comfortable, mini fridge in the room and bathroom was large and clean. Only thing is the carpet in the room as you enter needs cleaning due to high traffic otherwise no complaints. Recommend you pre-purchase the buffet breakfast much cheaper and children are free. Breakfast buffet had everything, eggs, bacon, cheeses, fruits etc. The pool was large and clean, garden area was very nice and relaxing well maintained. Hotel offers complimentary airport and city shuttle but limited times and only takes 36 passengers. So yo need to wait in the lobby 10 minutes prior if you want a seat, and half hour if you want to return on the shuttle, otherwise you need to make own way into Rome which is approx. 20 minute drive. The drop off and pickup locatiion is very convenient. Other reviews mentions about a train accross from the hotel but did not see any signs when I was there so not sure how that works. Hotel is in an industrial area, therefore there is nothing around the hotel which is ture with other reviews. Found one restauarant around corner and the price was average and the food was good. Hotel is fine as long as you don't mind travelling back and forth in order to get into Rome. Otherwise, I would recommend you look for another hotel closer in Rome. Would return with my family, because the price was right, hotel was clean and offers a pool whcih was great if you have free time to use it, which we did many times.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: justgotravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on our first night in Italy on several occasions. We just returned from our latest trip. The hotel needs to be updated. Worn out mattresses, worn out bedding, soiled worn carpets. The only thing it has going for it is the shuttle to and from the airport and into the center of Rome. There is now a Marriott and a Sheraton in the area with shuttle service. Give them a try instead.

Reviews.Title: “Grim and Shabby with Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah492
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, as we were coming back to Rome from Verona and not flying out until the next morning. This hotel is marked as a "preferred hotel" on the Rome Airport Website. They have a shuttle to the airport, but it is first-come, first-serve. While they did in fact get us to the airport on time, it was stressful worrying about whether or not we would have a seat. Plus, the shuttles run only at appointed times, so if you are late getting in, you will be forced to take an expensive cab. The hotel is fairly expensive and is in desperate need of updating, deep cleaning, and repair. The rugs are stained and threadbare, the pillows were flat and smelly, and the rooms were just plain depressing. Also, there was not a drop of coffee to be found anywhere in the hotel in the morning. For 150 Euro, even a crummy coffee maker in the room isn't too much to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: The best word to describe the Holiday Inn - Eur Parco dei Medici is "acceptable". The staff is decent, the bar is nice, the pool is very nice, but there is nothing that stands out about this facility. The decor is rather dated (a la the 1970s), and the location is not ideal for quickly and easily getting to downtown. The rooms are large and clean, and the breakfast buffet is decent (if overpriced). There is a free shuttle to take you downtown, but it does not run as frequently or as often as several other hotels that are also outside of downtown. If you are looking for a hotel from which you can experience a vacation in Rome, I would recommend looking for a place downtown or closer to downtown. If you are considering this hotel for a business trip, there are other hotels in the area that I would prefer (Sheraton Roma immediately comes to mind), but you could do worse than the Holiday Inn - Medici. If you are traveling with a family and are looking to relax at the hotel, the pool would make this hotel a good option. All in all, there was nothing terrible or off-putting about the Holiday Inn Medici, but there was also nothing that stood out to the point of me recommending it either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Stetcg
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel and facilities on the outskirts of Rome it is next door to a station were you can get a train into Rome for 1 Euro. Staff freindly, good outdoor pool only downside were the bar prices !!

Reviews.Title: “A convenient hotel for Rome touch-and-go's”
Reviews.Author: fredarin
Reviews.Content: This is a very straight-forward no-frills business hotel. I have stayed at least 50 nights so I have some experience. The location is perfect, although there is nothing to do in this area other than working. Between Rome and the airport. Huge taxi station nearby, so taxis are easy to get. Complementary shuttle to airport and Rome, although the schedule is not increadibly intense. If you have a rental car, there is never a problem finding a lot outside the hotel. The breakfast is decent. Part of it is good, part of it so-so. The rooms are big, but the bathrooms slightly dated. Not a big problem, though. All-in-all this is my goto hotel in Rome. It has nothing but still everything. It is just another Holiday Inn, but for some reason I have always liked it here. Guess its the location that makes it simple to get to and simple to leave. This hotel does not offer an unforgettable experience per se. Its just another hotel, but its convenient. I'll probably be back quite a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSailors
Reviews.Content: Big and noisy. Rooms are quite large with paper thin walls. Bar is great and drinks are very expensive ($12 for a gin and tonic). Thought it was near the airport and that's why we chose it, but still cost us Forty Euro to get there. While they have a shuttle, it doesn't start up until 7 a.m. So scratch early flights. Does have a huge swimming pool. The staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Rome, take a taxi to the airport”
Reviews.Author: RamblersOhio
Reviews.Content: With just a few tweaks this could be a better hotel. We selected it because a friend liked it and because it offered a free bus to the airport. We found it ordinary and expensive. The front desk staff was made up of beautfiul people, but they were kinda air-headed. We asked for non-smoking, went to our room and discovered it was a smoking room. We went back to the desk and finally got what we'd asked for. The hotel restaurant pasta was gummy (imagine! in Italy, gummy pasta) and the general quality of the place was not what we found elsewhere in Italy. The bar staff was condescending and not helpful. The bus to the airport was on time and provided excellent service. The Internet service provided by the hotel via Swiss-Air was expensive and didn't work. When the hotel person attempted to assist us (printer didn't work) she had to call Swiss-Air to get us a credit for the cost (we'd tried to print boarding passes). Once again: hotels should give free wireless service.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you must”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: old hotel - poor condition, but local to several businesses. The Sheraton Golf is very close and I would rather stay there but it is always heavily booked. Anyway - the hotel is acceptable standard but not good. Restaurant is funny (ha ha), not sure what to say about it really!

Reviews.Title: “Just convenience for Business”
Reviews.Author: PeeJee1999
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Holiday in at Parco Dei Medici because it's walking distance from my business location. Hotel is worn out. Rooms are big but old. Staff is not friendly. Food is below average and way too expensive. Has an outdoor swimming pool. Don't go here if you want to visit Rome is in the middle between DaVinci Airport and city center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not in near enough to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anddawede
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a tour group and although the hotel was excellant it was not close enough to Rome. They did provide a free shuttle (first come basis) to the center of Rome near the Forum and back. The room was clean and so was the bathroom. There was a restaurant and a pool but I did not take advantage of either. The subway has a stop within easy walking distance. This hotel would be better for business travelers than for sightseeing but great if need fast access to the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - What you would expect from the Brand in a business district”
Reviews.Author: travelt00much
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, as we were visiting family friends and this is one of the ones closest to them. It is in a business district of Rome, and just inside the suburbs of Rome. If you want to spend time seeing the sights, this hotel is too far out, unless you know your way around, stay somewhere closer to the city centre. however, it is Ideal for FCO airport, which is just down the road, fellow guests included stayovers for the offices around it and also the World Food Program. when we left on Saturday morning, hotel felt as though it would be empty most of the weekend.
