Rooms are exactly like you would expect from a Holiday Inn, Same standard, Bed, Pillows, Plastic sink area in Bathroom, only problem with room was that fan was not working so room was quite warm first night. Room and public areas spotless, and what interaction we had with the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Outdoor pool was closed because it was 'still winter', no problems with that though. Breakfast is expensive at 28 euro, and food is standard at city business hotel rates of 14 euros for a main course (Think of travellers that can claim on expenses). Eating areas immediatley outside the hotel are very limited Although I say I would reccomend this hotel to a friend and it is not a bad hotel, If I did not have family friends in Rome, I stay closer to tour the city centre. And yes i did hear the dogs in the pound barking at about midnight, but to me it was only for a few seconds, and only because there was no other noise outside at that time.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get robbed, this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: tiger02trip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night following a week in other parts of Italy because of the hotel's proximity to the Rome Airport. During the expensive breakfast ($30 for a basic buffet) I left my bags with the maitre d' of the restaurant who assured me that they were safe with him. Instead, a bag was stolen and conveniently found in a part of the hotel I'd never been to after I threatened to call the police. The rooms are mediocre, the food is expensive and not very good, and in my experience there's a major theft problem so I'd steer clear of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: jprrt228
Reviews.Content: My children and I have just returned from our stay at the Holiday Inn in Roma.I am dissapointed in the response/answers that I received fron the hotel staff. I asked 5x's if they took the Discover card. I called the hotel before my departure to check was told"Yes" we take the card. I checked on arrival and then during the trip in which they ran my card. btw..I wanted to make other arrangements if they didn't accept the card. The hotel ran my card and I was told I was just missing the pin. I made long distance phone calls to get the pin.At the time of check out after I handed the staff my card and was told they didn't take the card..it wasn't the pin.The manager pulled out (from under the counter) a lsit of credit cards they accept. Then she showed them to me and stuck it back under the counter..so no display..so I had to use my cash on hand whcih was all gone by the time I left the property...This is why I checked so many times. I was extrememly upset and no aplogy, "I'm sorry" or we made a mistake..The manager was upset with me ?? We are also sent for a short walk to the train station and then the nexy day in day light realized we were in a bad area.(gypsies) We were charged 80.00 Euros for a cab. It is a long distance from the city of Rome. Andre at the desk was the nicest part of the stay. He was friendly and accomodationg. I know many travelers who use Holiday Inn's overseas, but I won't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dive hotel with great website”
Reviews.Author: lllClifflll
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful, the price is fine, the breakfast is acceptable but the hotel is just old and suffers all the problems old hotels suffer. My room was smelly, the carpets were in poor condition, the beds were poor quality and the location (across from a dog yard of some sort) is awful in the evening with all the howling dogs. I would mark up this hotel for: Helpful staff good breakfast I would mark this hotel down for: Transfer options The "city bus" they offer has poor timing The "airport bus" is one in the same and runs at odd times Noise from a pound? Old rooms Odd odors in the hotel Dated interior Outdated technology and weak internet Awful hotel bar which is rarely open Just not near anything... I would not recommend this place to anyone I know. If you are thinking about this property it is far better to stay at the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back !”
Reviews.Author: rosetoit
Reviews.Content: We were not pleased with the Hotel or Service. This was our second time staying there within 4 years and we will not book this hotel on our return trip next summer. The soap dispenser in the bath had hair from a previous occupant...the pool attendant would not assist me with getting more towels when I discovered there were no more available. I had brought my 5 yr old son to the pool and he already jumped in and I had to take him back up to the room dripping with water and shivering from the AC upon entering the hotel. The front desk called for more towels after I produced my shivering child and complainted...Did Not help me but maybe for others. The shuttle bus is too small for summer season. We had to take a cab back to the hotel quite a few times. In fact, the last shuttle back to the hotel on Friday evening evolved into a fight from people pushing to get on to the bus. An elderly man was pushed back down the bus stairs. The restaurant staff and breakfast were ok. Again, l would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Traveller228Canada
Reviews.Content: It’s in the west end of the city in a quiet industrial park setting. The rooms have 2 queen beds which is great for a family with kids. Pool hours are 10 am to 8 pm so if you are in Rome for the day, you will not get to use it. As the buffet breakfast costs €16 per person, consider getting the rate that includes the breakfast. They have a free shuttle to/from airport and to/from Rome City Centre. The bus seats 44 passengers and the first one into Rome leaves at 9:30 am, last one from town leaves at 7:30 pm. Check their website for the hours of the shuttle. Get to the bus early for the first and last bus into and back from town, as it gets crowded. If you miss it, it’s a longer trip via the local train and then onto the metro/subway. Food is really expensive at this hotel, about €35-40 for a three-course meal. You can get great fixed priced menu deals at about half the price in Rome. There is a restaurant on the next block but it was closed for holidays while we were there. Consider using public transportation for unlimited travel daily with the Integrated Daily Ticket called the Biglietto Integrato Giornaliero (BIG) for €4 per person, available at the gift shop in the lobby. Overall, great value for the money if you are travelling with kids as you won't find too many European hotels with two queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chandrasoma123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Holiday Inn Rome-Eur Parco Dei Medici. Four of us including two kids who are 8 and 10 years old stayed in a family room. The room is quite big and clean. The room was cleaned everyday and towels were changed daily. There was one problem with the room, this was a interconnected room before and now it has been made as separate room by closing the door between rooms. They haven't done a good job of it. So, you can clearly hear the guests talking in the next room. Luckily, other room was empty most of the time during our stay. The food in the hotel is very expensive and the choice is limited. The hotel says kids eat free from the kids' menu if adults eat at the hotel. This is not true, an adult has to eat a three course meal (costs about € 50) to get a kid's meal (costs about € 7) free. If you are a single parent and you have two kids then you have to eat two three course meals to kids to eat free. I did not know this when I was booking the hotel. Be careful when you are booking. One day we ordered burgers for kids and me (wife is a vegetarian). They brought exacly the same size three burgers for us and charged € 14 for mine and € 7 each for kids. The hotel is no where near the town hence no shops or restaurents near it. There is a Pizza restaurent near by but unfortunately the pizzaman was on holiday during that week. In Italy, under 10 years old kids travels free on buses, trains and Metro. But one of the girls who woring in the hotel gift shop didn't know this and asked us to buy tickets for kids as well. By the way, the hotel gift shop is the only place in the area that you can buy travel passes. One thing I noticed that the people work in this shop are not freindly. If you want to visit Rome, then buy a one day Metro bus pass (just like one day travel card but you don't have to wait until 9.30 am). It costs € 4 and you can travel around Rome all day until midnight. The kids loved the swimming pool and there was a life guard all the time. Also, you get free towels at the swimming pool. Also, there is one table tennis table in the hotel (near the swimming pool) and we all enjoyed playing table tennis. The breakfast provided by the hotel is execellent, even you can have full English breakfast. In overall, we are very happy with the service provided by the hotel and do not hesitate to recommend to anyone. We paid €105 per night on BB basis for a family room.

Reviews.Title: “Average in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: isj4
Reviews.Content: Average price and quality. The restaurant is a bit expensive. The hotel is located in the middle of Parco Dei Medici, and there is nothing to see or do in the evening (no shops/restarants/bars/...). It is extremely conveniently located if working with some of the telco companies in the area, so I have stayed there multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in a quiet atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Nishant1
Reviews.Content: While travelling, you have to make your standard flexible for comparison of hotels. You cannot apply north american standard to european hotels. Else greater disappointment. This Holiday Inn has quite spacious rooms. Bathroom is big and clean although bath tub is narrow. We got it for 99 Euro inclusive of breakfast which was a good deal considering breakfast is charged at 16 euro otherwise Hotel provides courtsey airport pick up and drop of f service which is good. Also there is a shuttle service to Rome city but in a hotel of hundreds of rooms, a 35 seater bus is often inadequate. However , train station is 600 meters from the hotel from where you can reach Rome in one euro with one switch from train to subway. Breakfast is good- Typical european. However, dinner food quality is not good compared to great italian restaurants which are in downtown, It is better to eat in the city at night. Overall I would rate this hotel above average.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: mwisdom562
Reviews.Content: We staryed at this hotel as part of a 10-day tour of Italy with our daughter's high school chorus. Our stay at the Holiday Inn was three nights and I can say that it was uneventful. The rooms were clean if somewhat plain. They servedthe purpose of providing a comfortable place to sleep. A previous reviewer mentioned the sound of barking dogs, we noticed this too but since we did not open the window, were not really bothered by it. My only real compalin about the room was that the tub was rather narrow and it was a little awkward taking a shower. I do wish that Internet access had been less expensive -- 24 hours cost 17 Euro -- but we just did without. The pool area became the nightly meeting spot for the adults of our group to sit and have a glass of wine before heading to bed. We found it to be very comfortable and attractive. The hotel is convenient to the airport but, not to the historic centers of Rome. It took us nearly an hour each morning to get to the Vatican, Colliseum, or any of the historic locations. All in all, this hotel is comfortable and clean but nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: grandmaofsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 114 Euros/night waiting for a connecting flight to Libya the following morning after flying from Canada. The shuttle bus was a problem for us (as other reviews stated) but through the kind heart of another driver we and 5 other travellers managed to get to the hotel before the hotel's own shuttle left for the next trip to the airport. Supper at the hotel was not good at all. We both ordered fish and fish that is all mashed and mushy is not something we're used to at all and the stale rolls/bread were very bad too. But they filled the empty stomachs! Breakfast (which we pre-purchased) the following morning was much better. Great choices. If we travelled here again we would probably consider staying here but would just go across the street to the pizza restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: NITRIP
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my stay at this Hotel. Thanks to TA I knew what I was expecting here. This Hotel is not located in the heart of the city. The shuttle bus is at specific time but it works out well if you plan your trip acoordingly. We went during Hoildays and the hotel increased the number of shuttle buses due to high demand which was very nice.There is also a nearby station that takes you to the Termini station where you can take a bus/metro to where you need to go. The staff was very helpful and knew English. The room was American standard. Overall enjoyed my stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Felt deceived by Holiday Inn and Priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: pisco8peru
Reviews.Content: When I booked my stay through Priceline, the offer included breakfasts. When my wife and I arrived to the hotel, my wife asked one of the front desk attendants if our breakfast was included and she was told it was. Much to our surprise, after having our third breakfast, the waiter attending us left a bill on our table for 32 euros (around US$51). When we asked him what was that about, he simply walked us to the Front desk. Here we learned that two other bills had already been left there for the two previous breakfasts - a total of 96 euros! We told the people at the front desk that we found this unacceptable but they told us we would have to speak with the manager. That evening we tried to speak with the manager and had no luck. The next morning, during our check out (and after having no breakfast), we ended speaking with the same people from the previous morning (still no manager). We were pretty much forced to pay one of the breakfasts. They claimed our rate was extremely low and there was no way they could include us the breakfast. Had I known this from the beginning I wouldn't have booked a hotel that was so far away from the city centre. Not sure who's fault it is (the hotel's or Priceline's) but I felt deceived. Besides, the walls in the room were paper thin and you could listen to other guests' conversations at both end of the room at night. Definitely not impressed with the service and wouldn't recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generic Holiday Inn - Great value, but very forgettable”
Reviews.Author: ramses2nd
Reviews.Content: Generic Holiday Inn. Clean, comfortable, spacious and great value, especially if travelling with kids, who stay (and eat) for free. But also very bland. Perfect for a 1 night stay before catching a flight home, or a business trip, but don't come here for a holiday to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard and clean”
Reviews.Author: cd650
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel clean and of a good standard. There was an outdoor pool that was closed in March and a Gym which had a few running machines and a multi gym. I have seen much worse hotel gyms and much better, but it was ok . I booked on the hotels own website and bought breakfast in advance which works out much cheaper than buying breakfast at the hotel. I found a good enough range of food at breakfast, only the really picky eaters would find any fault there. On the reception in the evenings was an english receptionist which was helpful, but the other local staff knew good english. The hotel has free transport to and from the local airport ( 4 trips each way each day), we landed at a bad time and had to get a train. That was painless and the hotel was quite close by ( we walked it in 10 minutes slowly). There was also about 6 or 7 trips each way into the center of Rome each day. The last bus leaves Rome at 8PM, the trip is about 30 minutes so I would not liked to have seen the cost of a taxi had I missed it. Some evenings I was wondering if everyone was going to get on the last bus ( first come first served) and there were only 35 seats and no standing allowed. My advice is get there early for the bus. One other thing about Rome if you are going to get a hop on hop off bus MAKE SURE you get the 110 bus, It seemed to come every 10 or 15 minutes. The one we got had 2 routes, one route was one bus an hour and the other was one bus every 2 hours. We made a big mistake. If I went to Rome again I would stay in the town near the main train station, it was the sort of area that you would not go out after midnight, but it had loads of hussle and bussle and loads of good cheap places to eat. This hotel is great but we were board at night with nothing happening outside, no TV to watch and sky high internet prices. Things I think they could do a little better is get some English TV into the rooms and offer free internet, I never bothered bringing my laptop as holiday inn charge so much for internet access. If you decide to sit and have a coffee or snack in Rome just note that they charge double price if you sit down. Carry it out and you'll pay much less.

Reviews.Title: “#1 worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler19
Reviews.Content: In 40 years of travelling this has to be the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at. This so-called 4 star hotel doesn't rate even one star. My wife and I stayed here on a combination business/vacation trip (first time to Rome). The walls are thinner than paper. I shouldn't have to hear the guests on both sides of us going to the bathroom, and every detail of their conversations. There was no ice machine anywhere that I could find in the hotel. As typical with most European hotels there were no refreshment machines (soda, snacks, candy or in-room coffee/tea), and no refreshments we could buy in the gift shop. The beds were hard as concrete. We might as well have slept outside on the sidewalk, it would have been softer. They offer a choice of softer pillows, but don't expect to actually get them from the staff...we never did despite repeated requests. There is only one restaurant and the food and drinks were always room temperature (didn't seem very safe to eat). The one hamburger I tried tasted like salmon (cooked on the same grill as the fish, perhaps?). As typical in Italy, the heating/air conditioning system is controlled by the hotel. If it's mid-season, you don't get a choice of warm or cool air...the hotel decides for you. There is no fan in the room to circulate the air or drown out the noise from the neighbors. It does have a nice large swimming pool, though, so if you're visiting Rome to use the pool or to listen to the neighbors do their thing in the middle of the night or a one day business trip, maybe this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “If you are American do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: AmericanSteer
Reviews.Content: The Parco Dei Medici treated our American Family with disrespect and contempt. If the term stupid American sounds disrespectful then avoid the Parco Dei Medici Holiday Inn. If you think that all Italian hotels have free internet and the room rates include breakfast, do not stay at this hotel. It is apparent that this Holiday Inn does not like American Tourists, and their disrespect for Americans is obvious. I do not know if all Holiday Inns in Italy have the same disrespect, but we had much better luck at some of the smaller Italian run operations. The room needed new furniture and new carpet, my wife would not take off her shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot us @ the airport”
Reviews.Author: MOCAPE
Reviews.Content: We booked a room @ this Airport Holiday Inn because of the proximity to the Airport, the shuttle, and a slightly cheaper rate than the Airport Hilton. Bad idea we were never told of the limited schedule for the shuttle. When we arrived at the Airport @ 9:00 pm there was not a hotel phone to call for the shuttle, the pay phones at the airport are useless - we could not get through to the Holiday Inn. So we waited till 10:00 pm for the shuttle to drive by it never came. We then took a taxi 15 km 10 minutes and were charged $40.00 euro! The next morning we had a 8:15 am intl flight and needed to get to the Airport 2 hours early - they would not drive us and the taxi they got us charged us $45.00 euro! Transportation to and from the Airport cost us $85.00 euro!!!! It would have been a lot cheaper to stay at the real Airport hotel the Hilton as you can walk there. I don't why they advertise themselves as a Airport Holiday Inn they are not, and they hotel staff would not help us at all they were very rude.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff offered to return our rented car and then forgot to return it”
Reviews.Author: arthur63
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn lost our rented car We stayed at this airport hotel on sunday July 22, 2007, the night before we left for our honeymoon in the US. We arrived with a HERTZ rented car, which we were supposed to return at the terminal in Rome, the next morning. When we checked in, the hotel staff kindly suggested us to take the complimentary hotel shuttle to the terminal the next morning, while they would call HERTZ-airport office to collect the car the same day, with only a minimal extra charge. The granted us that this was a common service that they often offered to customers. Being on a tight schedule, we happily accepted it. We left the HERTZ car in their parking lot, leaving them the keys and a copy of the rental contract. Two days after, we were already in the US, and received a phone call from a worried HERTZ staff in Italy, telling us that the car we rented was lost and that they were going to charge us the cost of the whole car! I immediately called the Holiday Inn in Rome and they confirmed that they had forgotten to call HERZ to collect the car and the car was still in their parking lot!?! However, the hotel manager, had personally called HERTZ that morning to ask them to collect the car. 3 days had passed! The extra days would be charged on my credit card, but the hotel staff insisted that everything was ok and kept feeding me lies. When I asked to talk to the hotel manager - who had handled the procedure - they told me that he had just left for an overseas vacation and that he would be out of reach for a month!?! So I had to call back HERTZ in Italy (again long distance from the US, to Italy using my cell phone!) to inform them that the car was still at the hotel, but some HERTZ staff in Rome was going to collect it. The next day, (4th day!), I called HERTZ again to double check that the car had been returned. However, it was not over, since the hotel staff had not called HERTZ airport office - as they were supposed to- but a downtown Rome office instead!?! Therefore, for a while the car had been lost again, since HERTZ did not know where it was. In the end, the HERTZ staff had to call the Holiday Inn again to find out which HERTZ agency in Rome had the car! At the end of the day, I ended up paying about EUR 400,00, instead of EUR 100,00 that I was expected to pay for one day rental! No compensation was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Giova1
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights at the hotel in September 2007 and enjoyed our stay immensely. We have 3 young children who also enjoyed the hotel and they were made to feel most welcome. The room was spacious and very comfortable which for a family of 5 is some achievement. I am confused and perplexed at several other reviews that say the hotel food and drinks are expensive. These comments are most unfair and I cannot understand where they coming from but I suspect being visitors from the United States they may not have visited many other European hotels in major European cities before and so are unaware of the prices in similar hotels. For sure the prices in this hotel are more expensive than one would expect to pay outside but to claim they are very expensive is just not true when one compares this hotel with others in other big European cities, that is fact! The reality is, having stayed at many other similar quality hotels in other European cities, that this hotel compares very favourably with others and the prices are actually cheaper than I would have expected and certainly cheaper than most other hotels of the same class in London and Paris for example. I notoice people have also made comments that the hotel is not close to the centre of Rome. Well why was that a surprise to them? The hotel clearly states its location as 16 km out of Rome centre and it has never suggested it was close to the centre, We arrived fully aware of this so again I do not understand why others are moaning about this as its location is clearly stated. The benefits of this location are that after a day in Rome it is great, especially for famiilies with young children, to return to this hotel out of the city centre and enjoy its fabulous swimming pool that is open until 8pm. The kids loved it. It also close to Fiumicino airport. There is also a daily free shuttle bus to and from the centre of Rome which we took advantage off . It leaves at several times during the day and works excellently. The only slight negative point about this is that it can only accomodate 32 people so its first come first served. Maybe the hotel should invest in a larger coach to handle more people to reduce the risk of guests having to make their own way back to to the hotel if they were not able to get a seat. The restaurant is very good with some of the most polite, friendly and welcoming service my family and I have ever received! Again from my experience I do not see what there is to moan about this restaurant. Yes the prices could be a bit cheaper but again they compare very favourably with other similar quality hotels in other European cities. Yes the menu could be a bit more extensive but the food is good and the service fantastic, the staff are all, based on our experience, very friendly, warm, attentive and welcoming. There is a pizzeria close by, Verde Smeralda which disappointingly is closed Sunday's. You go out the main gate of the hotel onto tha main road, turn right then immediately right abd ts 100 yards on your left. About a 4 minute walk in total. I never tried it but was told it is reasonable with slightly cheaper prices than the hotel Some have said its tough to locate but I found it a relatively easy hotel to find. After all the directions given by the hotel are accurate! We drove up from the Southern Italy and followed the directions given on the Hotel's web site. It was not too difficult to find, just of junction 30 of Romes G. R. A. (ring road motorway). Thats what the directions said and that surprisingly is where it was! If you want a city centre hotel then book one in the city centre. If you want a hotel to retire to away from the city centre close to the airport after a long day site seeing then this hotel is great as you can relax by the large pool and avail yourself of all its other services. Being 10 minutes away from Fiumicino airport it was ideal for our return flight home to London. We would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!!”
Reviews.Author: geegee1130
Reviews.Content: Very hard to locate.. A 15 minute drive turned into 2 hours. Tiny sign pointing to hotel. No ice machine. Can use internet for a fee. Food was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult connections to the City”
Reviews.Author: Ebe_Bern
Reviews.Content: They advertise a good connection to the city (5-minute walk to the train station, 15-minute walk to the subway, and even a bus to Piazza Venezia). BUT. the 5-minute walk gets you to a poorly-served station where no tickets are available, and you wouldn't want to get here after dark. Ditto for the subway station -- but don't worry, because of the new line C that Rome is building, these subway trains don't run after 9:20pm anyway in order to give the workers access to the tunnels for the new line construction. And as far as the bus goes...well, it's 3x per day, so if you can schedule around it, I guess that's OK. Rooms are clean, functional, and the hotel is only 15-20 minutes from Fiumicino. If you have to stay near the AIRPORT, this is a good choice for a night...but if you want to stay near the CITY, better choices are available!

Reviews.Title: “loved the pool!”
Reviews.Author: nicruns
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We only stayed one night before we left Rome. We booked here because of the Airport Shuttle. It was located close to the airport but not to main attractions (not a problem for us). The pool with the outside bar was great! It was just what we needed to relax before our 10 hour flight!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrightser
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much from this hotel as we had sampled hotel quality in Rome before and weren't too impressed. On the face of it, we were a bit concerned that the hotel was so far away from the city but in practice this was a blessing since one hot day in Rome with kids (7 & 5) is enough and we availed of the courtesy shuttle bus for this. The rest of the time, we used to enjoy the excellent pool and the hire car for the surrounding area including Castel Gandolfo and the wonderful Osita Antica (recommend a visit). The hotel is also excellently positioned for Fiumicino airport (just a 10 min drive). The hotel staff were at all times extremely helpful and courteous - we were somewhat taken aback by this as its not always the case in large hotels. Room (Family room) was spacious and air conditioning was wonderful. Bar/restaurant was outrageously expensive so we availed of the Pizzeria Smeraldo Verde just around the corner (2 mins walk) - out the gate and turn left. All in all, this was a nice way to spend our final few days in Italy after a wonderful couple of weeks with friends and family in Northern Lazio. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely revisit it.

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel 15 minutes from Rome airport”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCH
Reviews.Content: My travel group and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night at the end of a 10 day trip to Rome and Sorrento. Check-in was efficient and the front desk staff were helpful. The hotel has a nice pool which closes at 6 pm so we were unable to take advantage of it since we arrived later than expected. Our bus driver had difficulty locating the entrance road to this hotel since it is located in a small industrial park about 30 minutes from downtown Rome. It is not well marked and railroad tracks on one side of the park make it difficult to enter the park itself without driving a bit out of the way. We ate at the hotel restaurant where the food was reasonably good but on the expensive side. My hamburger with vegetables was 13 euros. The pizzeria Esmeralda is just behind the hotel and appears to be more reasonably priced. We took the complimentary shuttle to the airport and the driver dropped us off right where we needed to be. Rooms were clean, larger than anything we had stayed in while in Italy, and provided a mini bar, hair dryer, and some very small shampoo/gel packets. You might want to bring your own if you stay here. If you don't mind being isolated from Rome or anything else for that matter, staying here should be no problem. If you would like to have the opportunity to see more of Rome or just get out and wander through the streets, then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good on paper”
Reviews.Author: colnmike
Reviews.Content: This was where we stayed on our last night and thank goodness it was only overnight. The hotel looked good when we walked in but it didn't live up to our expectations. We checked in at 9pm and left at 530 for our flight home. Check in was smooth but our card wouldn't work in the door to our room. A bellman let us in but never returned with new cards. The bathroom had seen better days as had the beds and the linens. The walls between the rooms were very thin, we were able to hear the conversation in the room next door. There were very few ammenities in the room - no water or kettle for a cup of tea. Overall, we weren't impressed and we were disappointed in the Holiday Inn as we have stayed in many here in Canada and in the UK and they have always been better than this. The highlight of our stay was the conversation with the night manager as we waited for our cab to the airport - he was very entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Save a LOT on transportation”
Reviews.Author: Perdido
Reviews.Content: Changed from the Best Western President in the center of Rome to this hotel on our last night because it was closer to the airport. Would highly recommend BOTH hotels. The taxi's would have cost us $55 Euro's each way .We took the train/bus to the Best Western and it cost 11 Euros and it was EASY to do , then we changed to this Holiday Inn and took their FREE shuttle from the center of Rome which was 3 blocks from the colliseum. It was CLEAN and ON time and it was totally FREE. I contacted the Holiday in in advance for their SHUTTLE schedule. Then I took the shuttle the next morning (there is a charge if you leave before 7AM). and the shuttle was once again free since I didn't need it until 7AM. The ONLY drawback is that the food is expensive , but very good. We paid $20 Euros per person to eat dinner (hamburger and salad bar), but it was delicious. THe salad bar was superb. They also have a pool and internet. The location is in the business district so there are NOt a lot of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- but housekeeping barges in @ luggage stolen out of shuttle”
Reviews.Author: travel5Utah
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively with my children. We stay at Holiday Inns all over the world and I am a Priority Club member. We are not hotel snobs and are usually happy with a couple of beds and a shower. Restaurants and food are not a problem because we carry our own by shopping in local supermarkets. (Sandwiches and Cereals ect.) We stayed at the the Holiday Inn Parco Dei Medici as the last night of our 2 week Italy travels. We arrived at 8:00 pm and anticipated to leave on the 7:45 am complimentary shuttle to the airport June 14, 2007. When we arrived there was no electricity in the hotel. The desk tells us it is routine maintence and there was no idea when they will be done. She also tells us there is no hot water. It was still daylight, so we were given our keys- but of course the elevators were not working so we carry all our luggage up 4 floors. Not Bad. Unfortunately, the hallways are pitch black so my daughter gives us the idea to use our cell phone lights to find our room number. (No flash lights or assistance was offered at the desk.) While checking in I requested an extra pillow and an iron. We got to our room and we had little day light left and with no electricity, we tried to hurry and get our cold showers and lay out our things in case there was still no electricty when we woke up. Right at 10:00 pm the lights came on!! Yeah!! I called to get the requested iron and pillow and this was brought up right away, but with one problem. My daughter was in the bathroom and my sons were on the bed. I was in the area by the door changing my clothes when a knock came at the door delivering the pillow and iron. However, the housekeeping did not just knock, they used their own key and promply opened my hotel room door with me standing there mostly nude. There was both a man and woman (house keeping) there from the hotel delivering the pillow and iron. I do not understand why they use their own key and deliver items this way! The next morning we were down for the 7:45 am shuttle. The shuttle was nice and big and we arrived about 7:40am. There was an IBM convention going on and lots of businessmen around. The shuttle driver loaded our bags and closed the trunk. We boarded the shuttle and the shuttle was about one third full. While we were waiting for our shuttle to depart, My younger son started screaming that someone was taken one of our bags and was walking away with it. We had a distintive large purple bow tied to our bags and he was pointing to a man who was walking quickly to a car that had just pulled up. He threw our bag into the car and they drove away. I jumped off the bus and the shuttle driver was coming out of the hotel assisting another passenger with his bags. He was now placing bags in the underside of the shuttle. I asked him to open the back compartment where we had placed our bags. With the language barrior he told me it was full. I said," I just want to check to see if all our bags are still there", He complied and sure enough, only two of our three bags were there. Apparently, since we were the last to fill the back compartment, our bags were on top. When the driver walked away, there were lots of business people around. The thief just opened the trunk grabbed the first bag on top and took off. When my son was yelling, several people on the bus got a good look at the thief but no license plate number. He had his own driver so they were gone quickly. Our bag contained all my sons' clothes, a portable DVD player, Movies, power cords for movie camera, unreplaceable video footage. Prescription glasses. Bummer. Be careful. Keep your bags guarded and do not board until time to leave. Insist that the shuttle driver locks the trunk when he leaves.

Reviews.Title: “4 days of intermittant electricty and wandering corridors in the dark”
Reviews.Author: Bornhune
Reviews.Content: I have just left this hotel after a stay of 4 nights whilst attending a business conference nearby. On three occassions when i returned to to my room there was no electricity on any hotel floor. the only lighting or power was in the lobby. it was explained it was a power company problem but adjacent buildings were powered, which didn;t make sense. Getting to my room involved walking up pitch black dark stairwells and corridors. There was no emergency lighting anywhere which was worrying! I had to wash my teeth to the light given out by my laptop before its batery failed. I lost out on the ability to work from my room after purchasing internet access!, watch tv, have air conditioning and light. For all of this i had to argue vocally for a discount when checking out and was given 20% discount on two nights of my stay. Outside of the electricity problem the staff were helpful and polite, food in hotel resteraunt was poor by italian standards. room was clean and general cleanliness high. would not recommend! if you need to stay in the area use the sheraton golf , ibis or marriot park hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bad and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: oldmandiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Rome-Eur Parco Dei Medici beacuse we flew in from Athens and had to fly home the next day.(May 10,2007) The good: There is a shuttle to and from the airport BUT the pick up at the airport was 30 min behind schedule and only because I saw the shuttle parked (driver was doing personal business) did we stay to use the shuttle. The shuttle schedule varies from 30 min to 2 hours between runs! The hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport by bus. The shuttle busses have marked parking places just across the street from the arrival terminal. Most have pickup schedules posted by their parking spot. Rooms were typical Holiday Inn. The rooms was big, clean, comfortable but the walls were thin. A cranky kid is the next room cried a lot... we heard it all. The Bad: The restauranrt prices were outrageous. We spent 3 weeks in Europe this time, three weeks last March and we are going back for a month in November so I"m not new to restaurant prices. The posted menu showed 18 Euros for a bowl of soup! Sorry but that is silly. When I asked about another place to eat I was told there was none...WRONG Right behind the hotel was a the Esmeralda restaurant/ pizzaria. Food was good, service was good, price was reasonable. Try it. It took less than 3 min to walk to the restaurant. The Ugly: The restaurant workers went on strike the day we left. The Week before AlItalia was on strike for a day. How can the Euro be so strong with the Italian economy in the mix!

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a dump”
Reviews.Author: portugalrocks
Reviews.Content: This "airport" hotel is a 15min shuttle bus ride to the airport, so not that nearby. The area of the hotel is more industrial with office buildings. Only the hotel restaurant and one other nearby to choose from. The room itself was large, but substandard. Furnishings and bathroom were just plain old. On the bright side...front desk staff was quick and efficient, shuttle bus driver was very friendly and if you're only staying one night, you may be able to overlook the sad state of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chi-towngurl
Reviews.Content: The hotel and restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful. My stay was great. The rooms were clean and a lot better than many hotels in Europe. The location is accessible by train and nearby Rome's airports. The hotel does offer shuttle service but has limited pick-up times and only seats the first 35 people. For a hotel that size, it is in desperate need of shuttles and more pick-up times. Also, don't bother with the travel agency in the hotel because the staff was rude .

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: brudda
Reviews.Content: I found hotel prices in Rome to be very high. This Holiday Inn was reasonable and offered a free bus shuttle. I found the hotel to be very nice. The rooms were very quiet, clean and large. I found the hotel rooms in Istanbul very small and coming to Holiday Inn was a great change. There are four elevators and this cut the wait time. The pool looked very inviting. The lobby had TVs and ample seating. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant, due to the negative reviews about it. Instead, I went to the Pizza Restaurant I heard about on TA. Go out the front door and turn right, It is just a block away, behind the hotel. The food is good and reasonable. I saw a couple get a cab to their hotel, at the airport, and they were asked to pay 55 Euros. This is a lot of money. By taking the shuttle back and fourth to the airport, I saved some money. The hotel is mid-point to the airport and Rome. I did not have time to take the free shuttle to Rome. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pearlcat
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to spend the outrageous amounts of money required for a hotel near the Rome airport, the Holiday Inn Parco dei Medici is a good alternative, especially if you have a rent car you want to return before your flight. It's an easy 10-15 minute drive to Leonardo Da Vinci airport and parking is free and safe on the grounds of the hotel. It is a professionally-run affiliate of the Holiday Inn franchise and looks no different from any other Holiday Inn you've ever stayed at in the U.S. (U.S. citizens, if you're travel-weary, this can an advantage.) It is located in an upscale office-park complex that rolls up the sidewalks after 6 p.m., so there are no restaurants, shops or nightlife nearby. When you get in from your busy day, expect to just eat in the hotel restaurant (which is good), watch cable TV and go to bed. The staff is competent, friendly and they all speak English. The hotel has a shuttle bus, but inquire about its schedule as it is not a 24-hour service. Three blocks from the hotel is a train station (Muratella). Though short, don't try this walk loaded down with large bags as there are stairs. This train is mainly good if you want to tour Rome on foot for a few days before or after your flight. This train line is NOT the main airport train, which is called the Leonardo da Vinci line and runs from the central Termini station to the airport, but rather a parallel local line that runs from the Ostiense station in central Rome to Da Vinci airport. At Ostiense station, you walk a few blocks more to pick up the Metro subway system. You would not want to use the Muratella station after dark, as it is small and empty at night and frequented by the local gypsy population, who use it to commute to their begging jobs in central Rome. Generally speaking, we found this hotel comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: melancton
Reviews.Content: Spent three weeks here on business trip. The sole positive I can think of about the hotel is that it had a modern gym area and sauna, and arguably it offers an infrequent, but free bus into town. Negatives: 1. Its in the middle of a business park, with only a small pizzeria in walking distance. 2. It's food is overpriced, as is the mini bar, and uninspiring - the breakfast is identical every day. 3. The area it is in resembles slough/ bracknell on a good day, and so there are no views worth talking about. 4. Your also on the main railway line between Rome and the airport - making you a target for sneak thieves especially in the Travatore/ pyramid part. 5. Rooms are large, but are essentially out of date in terms of decor. 6. In terms of entertainment, the sat tv is limited, the pay tv is expensive so you'll have to go into Rome - which if you want to stay to a reaonable hour, means a train/ underground back.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: SMcBaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. No issues. Our rate came with 2 breakfasts, otherwise hotel breakfast, which was only buffet because the restaurant was closed for maintenance, would have been a little pricey. It was good, though. The room was nice, very clean and modern. And it was thoroughly air conditioned, something not always found in Italy!! Nice pool. It was far from the tourist areas of the city, but I knew this at the onset....but the low cost (comparatively) is why I chose this hotel. There is a pizzeria nearby, they serve pasta and other dishes as well. Decent food and fair prices. The bus to and from the city was great....avoiding the hassle of driving and parking made the ride (about 30 mins) worth it!! Do get there early if you want to take the first bus of the morning...it did fill up. And on the return, they WILL leave early if the bus is full...the driver did warn us about that. It is a brand new, air conditioned bus that accomodates about 32 or so people. Not a lot of local flavor here but very clean and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Caution. This hotel is not recommended”
Reviews.Author: stay124
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling internationally 20+ days per month for the past 4 years, so I'm no stranger to staying in hotels, including but not limited to Intercontinental hotels around the world. :-) My stay at this Holiday Inn ranks definitely in the top 3 worst hotel stays ever!! The property itself is fine and clean. The pool is very pretty. However, everything else about the hotel is deplorable...staff and service included. Concurring with what many reviewers have already said, here are a few key things to be aware of if you're considering this hotel. 1. It is located in a business park in the middle of NOWHERE, in anytown, anycity. There is NOTHING (except one pizzeria) within walking distance of the hotel. ie. no cafe, no deli, no convenience store...na dah! The closest store is 2 train stations away. Bottles of water cost just under 4 euros at the hotel. 2. The hotel's free shuttle bus does indeed have a published schedule that goes back and forth to centro Rome every four hours or so. Be careful though. The bus may depart before its scheduled time...as I learned the hard way! And if you run into trouble, don't expect the front desk staff or management to be at all sympathetic. Guests are like annoying mosquitoes to them. Staff seem to be more concerned about adhering to stringent hotel rules and internal policies than they are about satisfying their guests. 3. Since you'll be stranded at the hotel it would be nice if the food was tasty. No such luck! Food at the hotel is bland, luke warm and very expensive. Food service is no better. I ate dinner at the hotel one night (because there is nowhere else to eat nearby). There were approx. 7 wait staff serving about 4 tables. After having to ask for a menu and then waiting 20 minutes, I ended up walking over to the huddled wait staff to ask them to please take my order. Coffee is thick and cold. A plain chef's salad with stale bread costs about 12.5 euros. If you're hungry between 15:00 and 19:30, don't expect to be able to order food from the hotel. The kitchen is closed during those hours...even room service. 4. One final note about room service. A charge of 7,8 euros per person will be added to the bill. Bottom line: In my opinion this is a hotel for business guests who are in Rome to work 12+ hours per day and need a clean place to sleep and drink cold coffee. This is not a tourist hotel and should not be advertised as such. Hope this helps.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Rome - Eur Parco Dei Medici
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Castello Della Magliana 65, 00148 Rome, Italy
